question.title: How to use Java Selenium ChromeDriver to passed Cloudflare bot checking?
question.body:
I know this question has been asked many times, but all I found is using Python programming which is I am totally not familiar. I also follows this article to add Request headers, and this to understand how to passed Cloudflare, but again its in Python.

Below is my code in a simple Java code:

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Proxy proxy = ClientUtil.createSeleniumProxy(proxy());
        ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions();
        options.setProxy(proxy);
        options.setAcceptInsecureCerts(true);
        options.setEnableDownloads(true);
        options.setPageLoadStrategy(PageLoadStrategy.NORMAL);
        options.setPageLoadTimeout(Duration.ofSeconds(20));
        options.setScriptTimeout(Duration.ofSeconds(20));
        WebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver(options);
        driver.get("https://solscan.io/");
    }

    private static BrowserMobProxy proxy() {
        BrowserMobProxy proxy = new BrowserMobProxyServer();
        proxy.start(0);
        proxy.enableHarCaptureTypes(CaptureType.REQUEST_HEADERS);
        proxy.addRequestFilter((request, contents, messageInfo) -> {
            request.headers().add("Accept", "text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8");
            request.headers().add("Accept-Encoding", "gzip, deflate, br, zstd");
            request.headers().add("Accept-Language", "en-US,en;q=0.9");
            request.headers().add("Cache-Control", "max-age=0");
            request.headers().add("Priority", "u=0, i");
            request.headers().add("Connection", "keep-alive");
            request.headers().add("Platform", "Win64");
            return null;
        });
        return proxy;
    }
}

I am hopping that there are a lot of java developer that has passed through this. I need help, a link to any java repo that solved this problem will also appreciated. And please do not ask me to use solscan.io API.

Thank you
